verbose_text: Briefly, rhChi3l1 treatment exhibited pro atherogenic effects in vitro, as measured by monocyte-EC adhesion, inflammatory gene expression, and reduced NO generation in ECs along with enhanced VSMC proliferation and migration, whereas Chi3l1 knockdown yielded the opposite effects along with inhibiting atherosclerotic plaque development and vascular inflammation in vivo.
evidence: rhChi3l1 treatment exhibited pro-atherogenic effects in vitro, as measured by monocyte-EC adhesion, inflammatory gene expression, and reduced NO generation in ECs
